definition: becoming more prosperous with each passing day
to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)
to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: At this festive occasion, wish business was flourishing.
sentences.chinese: 值此佳節之際，恭祝事業蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: The final Zhu Gui company has a bright future , wishes that your cause is ever more flourishing.
sentences.chinese: 最後祝貴公司前程似錦，祝您的事業蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: I sincerely wish us blooming career and lasting friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我衷心祝願我們的事業蒸蒸日上，友誼地久天長。

sentences.english: He was very hardworking, and the farm always prospered under his care.
sentences.chinese: 他非常勤勞，而且農場在他的照管下蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: On the occasion of the Spring Festival, good business.
sentences.chinese: 值此新春佳節之際，恭祝事業蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: The firm discovered that underselling actually boosted its business.
sentences.chinese: 公司發現有節制的推銷實際上使其業務蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: The young lawyer who moved to New York gets on swimmingly .
sentences.chinese: 搬到紐約去的那個青年律師事業蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: " Only 12% of Chinese described themselves as "thriving.
sentences.chinese: 只有12%的中國人認爲他們生活“蒸蒸日上。”

sentences.english: As eBay began to take off, so did their business relationship.
sentences.chinese: 隨着易趣開始起步，他們的合作關係也蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: I wish a brisk business for you all and a continue development in our business dealings.
sentences.chinese: 祝大家生意興隆，蒸蒸日上。

definition: prosperous
undertaking/project/activity/(charitable, political or revolutionary) cause/publicly funded institution, enterprise or foundation/career/occupation/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
prosperous/thriving/to prosper/to flourish
prosperous and developing/flourishing
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
(idiom) flourishing/thriving
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
flushed with success/proud of one's success (in exams, promotion etc)/as pleased as punch
glorious and flourishing (idiom); thriving
thriving and prosperous business or trade
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
to be successful in business/professional success
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
